item.title: Ticket #4547 (Convert WP from magpie to Simplepie) updated
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description:
Replying to Otto42:

Using Google's AJAX API is certainly a possibility for the dashboard, however it doesn't solve the more generic problem of reading feeds for other purposes. It would be beneficial to have generic feed reading capabilities in Wordpress because there are many, many other reasons to read feeds than just displaying news on the dashboard.

Their API returns normalized data structures that are much easier to parse than RSS/Atom, and it's forward-compatible. I think it would give us the combined benefits of supporting all types of feeds current and future, no ongoing maintenance on our part, and reducing the size and complexity of what's bundled with WP.

item.title: Ticket #4547 (Convert WP from magpie to Simplepie) updated
item.dc:creator: link92
item.description:
Replying to markjaquith:

Determine why SimplePie requires PHP 4.3, and see if it is feasible to code a compatibility layer to keep WP requirements static.

As of r775, SP supports PHP4.1 and up.

Have SimplePie use existing DB caching system.

See my patch in prior bug.

item.title: Ticket #3299 (clean_url() not working for non-HTTP URLS) updated
item.dc:creator: pishmishy
item.description:
Owner, Status, Summary changed

The following code from clean_url() strips @ from URLs. 

$url = preg_replace('|[^a-z0-9-~+_.?#=!&;,/:%]|i', '', $url);

The following code from clean_url() prepends ​http:// onto non-http URLs 

if ( strpos($url, '://') === false &&
                substr( $url, 0, 1 ) != '/' && !preg_match('/^[a-z0-9-]+?\.php/i', $url) )
                $url = 'http://' . $url;

item.title: Ticket #3299 (clean_url() not working for non-HTTP URLS) updated
item.dc:creator: pishmishy
item.description: #4574 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug.

item.title: Ticket #4574 (cannot add "mailto" link in blogroll) closed
item.dc:creator: pishmishy
item.description:
duplicate:

Duplicate of #3299.

item.title: Ticket #4574 (cannot add "mailto" link in blogroll) created
item.dc:creator: kostuj
item.description: In previous versions used I had no trouble adding a "mailto:blog@…" link in the sidebar to contact the blog's author. In upgrading to 2.2.1 however, I cannot accomplish this using the blogroll (used to be "links") function. An "​http://" is added to and the "@" symbol does not take from the entered address. I have tried variations in writing the e-mail address to no avail, and this seems like a basic function that should exist but that I cannot get to work. It still may be me, but on the forum someone suggested I write a ticket for this problem, so maybe it is not just me. Thank you.

item.dc:creator: JeremyVisser
item.description:
In wp-comments-post.php, at the very top, there is a small instance of double quotes being used where single quotes should be used (performance), and spaces used when tabs should be used.

Patch attached is patched against trunk rev 5773.

Environment

  • WordPress trunk (2.3)
  • WordPress MU 1.2.2

item.title: Ticket #4566 (Cron Not Getting Called (fsockopen failing)) updated
item.dc:creator: westi
item.description:
Replying to matt:

Calling localhost should be fine if you include the proper host: header.

Only if the apache or other httpd is listening on all interfaces which may not always be true on a multi-ip hosted server.

item.title: Ticket #4572 (Empty categories being shown in wp_list_categories) created
item.dc:creator: cnorris23
item.description: As of the 2007-07-01 nightly build the wp_list_categories template tag lists empty categories even when the hide_empty parameter is explicitly set to true. Using the exclude parameter removes them from the list, but obviously that's not practical or ideal.

item.title: Ticket #4358 (Allow users to specify "primary" category) updated
item.dc:creator: starlyth
item.description:
My UI suggestion would be a simple drop down menu above the current category menu selection "window".

I also have to say that, while I will not change the properties, I think this is a defect, as it does mess your permalink structure. I feel this is just below blocker as a priority. My guess that the major ramification is that this would be a one way database upgrade.

item.title: Ticket #4495 (fetch_rss doesn't, after upgrade from v2.12 to 2.2) closed
item.dc:creator: daviding
item.description:
wontfix:

Upgrading my other two blogs from v2.12 to v.2.2 -- so all all symmetric again -- seems to have solved the problem.

It's a mystery -- but probably not worth putting any effort into figuring out.

item.title: fix_option_parsing.diff attached to Ticket #4571
item.dc:creator: m0n5t3r
item.description: patch to address the issue

item.title: Ticket #4571 (broken option values after saving) created
item.dc:creator: m0n5t3r
item.description:
options.php calls trim and stripslashes on option values submitted from options pages.

When one of the values is an array, this breaks it and update_option saves the string "Array" in the database, which is, most of the times, not what the (plugin) options page author intended.

item.title: Ticket #4570 (Comment link cannot contain IRIs) created

item.description: If you try and create a comment with a link such as "​http://www.詹姆斯.com/" it is rewritten to "​http://www..com/", which isn't overly useful.

item.title: Ticket #4563 (actions `admin_print_scripts-*' and `admin_head-*' useless) updated
item.dc:creator: m0n5t3r
item.description:
this can be worked around by constructing the action name like this: 

sanitize_title(__("Options")) . "_page_$myname";

maybe $admin_page_hooks should be built before calling load_default_textdomain?

item.title: wp-ticket-4563-demo.tar.gz attached to Ticket #4563
item.dc:creator: reedom

item.title: Ticket #4563 (actions `admin_print_scripts-*' and `admin_head-*' useless) updated
item.dc:creator: reedom
item.description:
Well, made 3 files. Archived in ticket-4563-demo.tar.gz.

5 steps:

  1. please install the ​http://svn.automattic.com/wordpress-i18n/ja_JP/trunk/messages/ja.mo Japanese .mo file and set WPLANG to "ja".
  2. extract ticket-4563-demo.tar.gz into the plugins directory.
  3. apply patch file plugin.php.diff in the archive against wp-includes/plugin.php. This makes apply_filters() and do_action()' log their arguments to /tmp/wp_ticket_4563.log`.
  4. for the problem #1 of my first post, in the admin panel activate the plugin #4563-1, click [options] - [#4563-1], then grep as the option page displays.
  5. for the problem #2, deactivate the plugin #4563-1 and activate #4563-2, click [options] - [#4563-2], then grep as the option page displays.
